column4: ok this is really messed up, i have an audio cd  in my cdrom drive but cannot access it through /dev/cdrom, Ive always used /dev/cdrom for as long as i can remember. but seeing as this is an audio CD it appears to be a different situation. what is happening?
please help, this has been a major headache for me over the last 6 months
how can i copy an audio cd from the command line?
OR how can i copy an audio cd with only a single mouse click? my mom is an areobics instructor and cannot handle copying her cds with linux if it requires more than 2 clicks of the mouse
thats all it is..  right click, copy
if its too much to right click make iso, right click iso, burn.. then good luck in windows.
you can add stuff, and then mount -a
but its lost on reboot, without persistence.

r007, what i want todo is have it mount my thumbdrives second partition as /home. Im doing the livecd customization and am nervous cause it appears fstab is only a placeholder (im expecting it to be overwritten) (im booting using grub2's loopback feature)
why not just install ubuntu to the thumbdrive..
im working with a 1gb drive, the squashfs is allowing me to have LOTS of extras, in fact i dont even think it would let me install to a 1gb drive
so just make the usb with usb-creator and with persistence?
can you give me a link to that? Ive heard of it but never tried it (i really dont want packages updating and such, i really only want persistance on /home)
10.04.1 LiveCD (i have no hdd til seagate sends it back)
ah ok.. well should still work.   its in System/Admin - Startup Disk Creator
im assuming i can customize a livecd and still use startup disk but with my CD?
erase it so it makes 1 fat32 partition, then choose your iso to make it from, and how much (probably maximum) persistence.
